results.title: Architecture - Quo Vadis?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Architecture at the Crossroads Series”.
The final part of a series which examines the main themes in world architecture today. The series looks at the work of architects who are at the centre of the current debate, and introduces some younger architects who are beginning to make a name for themselves. Which will be the seminal buildings of the 1980s and 1990s? This final program looks at some of the big projects for Paris, and asks whether the change that architecture is undergoing throughout the world will produce a more humane environment.

results.title: Texas: Instant Cities
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Architecture at the Crossroads Series”.
Part of a series which examines the main themes in world architecture, the work of architects who are at the centre of the current debate and introduces younger architects who are beginning to make a name for themselves. Part Nine deals with Texas, which issues more building permissions each year than any other State. Houston and Dallas have consequently become the most exciting cities in which to look at architecture. These “pop-up” cities are like a blackboard on which the problems of modern architecture are being chalked up. They show the 21st Century in the making - a prospect that is intriguing, daring and deeply disturbing.

results.title: Turn me on: the history of the vibrator
results.creator_credit: Warwick Burton, Catherine Chauchat and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Turn Me On explores the history of the vibrator. Through a group of sexpert characters, the documentary uncovers the socially camouflaged sex toy - hidden in the underwear drawer since it was invented over 120 years ago. Turn Me On reveals a social and sexual history that some people would prefer remained a secret.

results.title: Houses Fit for People
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Architecture at the Crossroads Series”.
Part Eight of a series which examines the main themes in world architecture today. The series looks at the work of architects who are at the centre of the current debate, and introduces some younger architects who are beginning to make a name for themselves. Part Eight deals with domestic housing. Most famous architects are concerned with commercial and institutional architecture. Ordinary people have to live in “junk” but there are signs that housing design is undergoing a change for the better. In the suburbs of Paris and London, a more humane architecture is beginning to emerge which challenges the monotony of the “new town” ideal.

results.title: Sammy Blue
results.creator_credit: Isabel Perez, Kim Farrant and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Sammy Blue is a young boy who wants to escape from the white noise of reality in his everyday life. If only he could be just like his goldfish “Blue” and swim around the bowl – forgetting everything, living moment by moment.
Features Andrew S. Gilbert as father, Claire Paradine as mother, William Balmford as Sammy and Zoe Carides as Mary.

results.title: Stop the Bulldozer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Architecture at the Crossroads Series”.
Part Seven of a series which examines the main themes in world architecture today. The series looks at the work of architects who are at the centre of the current debate, and introduces some younger architects who are beginning to make a name for themselves. All over the world people are fighting the tendency to destroy the old. Stations are being turned into museums, factories into concert halls. Everywhere old buildings have been given new life. Part Seven looks at the reconstruction of the historic centre of Frankfurt, the new museum in Paris and the revitalised shopping malls of America.

results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Tim Kreibig and Anna Fraser
results.brief_description: For Sophie, every day is full of choices… Independent person? Mother? Consumer? Woman? What will it be today? Features Lucy Bell as the woman and Lily Fraser as the little girl.
